hedline.hl1: Woman Kills Her Family and Then Herself

abstract.p: Police say JoAnn Gelsomino shot and killed her daughter Amanda, son Anthony and husband Robert before killing herself in their Mahopac, NY, home (S)

block.p: A 47-year-old woman shot and killed her two adult children and her husband in the family's Mahopac, N.Y., home last week before killing herself, the police said yesterday.
The woman, JoAnn Gelsomino, 47, left a suicide note that told of the killings, but there was no clear motive, detectives from the Town of Carmel police said.
A 47-year-old woman shot and killed her two adult children and her husband in the family's Mahopac, N.Y., home last week before killing herself, the police said yesterday.
The woman, JoAnn Gelsomino, 47, left a suicide note that told of the killings, but there was no clear motive, detectives from the Town of Carmel police said.
The police went to the home yesterday after a co-worker called to say that Mrs. Gelsomino's daughter, Amanda, 22, had not shown up for work on Thursday or Friday, officials said.

Investigators believe that sometime after 2 a.m. Thursday morning, Mrs. Gelsomino left a car running in the garage in an attempt to poison her family, officials said. They said that she stepped outside after opening a door from the garage so that the car's carbon monoxide fumes would enter the house.

Investigators said a coroner's report showed that the three victims were knocked out by the fumes. Mrs. Gelsomino then shot her husband, Robert, 59; her son, Anthony, 22, and Amanda before turning the gun on herself, officials said.
